Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: lip glazed; in handle zone, palmette on left with added red, and naked male figure (hair in red, torso and right arm remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 43, pl. XXI, no. 45)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 402, no. B597)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1395) (phase 3)
